```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
m <- sample(10:99, 1) # mass (kg)
v <- sample(1:10, 1) # speed (m/s)

ans <- 0.5 * m * v^2
dis <- c(m*v^2, 0.5*m*v)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\mathsf{\\,J}$", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```

Question
========
An object of mass `r fmt(m, 1)` kg is moving with speed `r fmt(v,2)` m/s. What is its kinetic energy?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```


Solution
========
The kinetic energy is
$$E_k = \frac{1}{2} m v^2 = \frac{1}{2}(`r m` \mathsf{\,kg}) (`r v` \mathsf{\,m/s})^2 = `r signif(ans,3)` \mathsf{\,J}$$
